quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

quote: Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the wise. Seek what they sought.
author: Matsuo Bashō

quote: Wisdom is not a product of schooling but of the lifelong attempt to acquire it.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
author: Plato

quote: It is not what we get, but what we become, what we contribute that gives meaning to our lives.
author: Tony Robbins

quote: Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: He who opens a school door, closes a prison.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Wisdom is the reward you get for a lifetime of listening when you’d have preferred to talk.
author: Doug Larson

quote: Common sense in an uncommon degree is what the world calls wisdom.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
author: Jimi Hendrix

quote: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: The wise man does at once what the fool does finally.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

quote: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Wisdom begins in wonder.
author: Socrates

quote: Do not be wise in words, be wise in deeds.
author: Jewish Proverb

quote: Wisdom is knowing what to do next; virtue is doing it.
author: David Starr Jordan

quote: In seeking wisdom, the first step is silence, the second listening, the third remembering, the fourth practicing, the fifth teaching others.
author: Solomon Ibn Gabirol

quote: The wise man doesn’t give the right answers, he poses the right questions.
author: Claude Levi-Strauss

quote: Wisdom is the power to put our time and our knowledge to the proper use.
author: Thomas J. Watson

quote: We are made wise not by the recollection of our past, but by the responsibility for our future.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Cleverness is not wisdom.
author: Euripides

quote: Wisdom comes not from age, but from education and learning.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Give me wisdom and knowledge, that I may lead this people.
author: King Solomon
